content: A Drawer is a panel that slides in from an edge of the screen. It is composed of `Drawer`, `DrawerContent`, `DrawerHeader`, `DrawerBody`, and `DrawerFooter`.
The drawer can be placed on the `left`, `right` (default), `top`, or `bottom` of the screen. It also supports multiple `sizes` from `xs` to `full`.
By default, a drawer is dismissable (on Esc or overlay click), but this can be disabled. It blocks interaction with the content behind it and traps focus within itself for accessibility.

The `backdrop` can be `transparent`, `opaque`, or `blur`. The enter/exit animations can be customized with `motionProps`. Individual slots like `base`, `header`, `body`, and `footer` can be styled with `classNames`.
